intro: Barlia robertiana, commonly known as the Robert's barlia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
